events.message: The claimant reported a car collision on the morning of April 30th causing damage to the front bumper and hood.
Upon review, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to involvement of a vehicle collision.
A claims agent specializing in vehicle accident cases was assigned to handle the claimant’s case promptly.
The claimant received formal acknowledgment that their auto accident claim was received and is being processed.
Additional documents including police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates were requested from the claimant.
The claimant submitted all requested documents on time, including detailed photographs and an official police accident report.
An investigation was initiated to assess liability and verify the extent of damages related to the collision.
The investigation confirmed the claimant’s account and verified all damages and police report details as accurate.
A settlement offer was proposed covering vehicle repairs and rental car reimbursement during the repair period.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the prompt communication and the settlement amount proposed.
The claim was formally approved after settlement terms were agreed upon by both parties.
Payment covering the approved settlement amount was issued to the claimant’s designated account.
Following payment issuance, the auto accident claim was officially closed with no remaining issues.
